text: Very nice aroma of poppyseed cake with lots of spices and decent background of chocolate and a bit of roasted malts. Lots of sweetness, frosting, some sweet spices and chocolate on the tongue. A bit onedimensional, but very enjoyable (not for those who dislike sweetness in beer - theres huge amount of it in there and its not really countered by anything)

Appearance: Deep rich brown black with a finger of tan medium to small bubbles
Nose: Rich dark cocoa with hints of mineral. 
Taste: More of the nose. Rich cocoa flavor with a bit of a mineral finish. Bits of anise and plum as well. interesting. ABV a little more evident in this offering
Body: Full and round. 
Parting thoughts: I just noticed this was technically an Imperial porter. Id have never guessed. Quite Imperial stout ish. Again the mineral hint takes me off my game though. its an aspect I cant help but notice, apparently, and do not favor.

Bottle at Sori Taproom. Black color, beige head. Bitter taste with chocolate, toffee, nuts, a bit of coffee, licorice and dark fruits. Bitter finish with roasted malts, nuts, chocolate, licorice, dark fruits, toffee and coffee. Excellent imperial stout.
Vom Fass im Stone Brewing Berlin 2017-04 getrunken. Erst kommt für kurze Zeit ein Mokkanote auf, doch dann dominieren fette Schokoladenaromen dieses geile Porter.

Aromat: mocny, ostry aromat, przyjemny, wiśnie likierowe, czekolada gorzka, trochę mlecznej, kawa i paloność, nuty ciasteczkowe.
Wygląd: czarne, oleiste, gęste, bardzo ładna ciemnobrunatna warstwa piany, po jakimś czasie zanikająca.
Smak: cała masa gorzkiej i mlecznej czekolady, wiśnie w czekoladzie, kawa, kakao, pralinki, palona kawa i palone słody. Są tu jakieś nuty ciasteczkowe, ale donatów jako takich nie stwierdzam. Aksamitne, gładkie i dobrze ułożone, zdecydowanie słodkie, alkohol ukryty, bardzo przyjemne odczucie w ustach likieru czekoladowego i wiśniowego, pełnia ciała. Lekka palona goryczka, dobry balans, bardzo smaczne i wyraźne piwo, mały minusik za brak tytułowych donatów. Ale piwko super.
backlog. Black with somewhat of a brown head. Aroma is pastry, toasted malt, slight chocolate, cocoa. Silky mouthfeel, very nice

Tap. Tasted on the 11/05/2017 at Olbaren (Copenhagen). Dark brown colour with a minimal tan brown head. Aroma of chocolate, sweet roasted malts and coffee. Taste is strong coffee and black cocoa with an alcoholic finish. Aftertaste is intense alcohol and strong bitter. Next one please!
Aromat głównie kawowy, nieco kwaśny. Podobnie w smaku słodka kawa, nieco marcepana.

On tap at Brewski. Pours black with beige head. Choc malt sweetness balanced by just enough hops. Had alongside Biscotti Break and it was quite similar. Not sure where the line on I-stout/I-porter lies
Sweet aroma with bread and chocolate notes. Pale black with a nice creamy foam. High sweetness with a full body, overall very tasty and delightful beer.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.

Kolor czarny, piana ciemnobeżowa,obfita. Aromat ciemnych owoców - wiśnia, śliwka, kakao, ciasteczka, wanilia. W smaku likier wisniowo - kakaowy. Bardzo słodkie, goryczka niska - alkoholowa. Sam alkohol nieźle ukryty.

Sweet, dark, toasted malts, rye, dark molasses, sweet chocolate, rich cacao. Black, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More sweet grain malts, molasses, caramel, biscuit, light, sweet straw, soft carbonation, full bodied. Nice Impy, great aroma and palate. Keg at Ølbaren, Copenhagen.
Pours black with small head. Aroma: a nice aroma of coffee, marshmallow, vanilla and dark fruit. Taste: nice thick coffee, dark malt, with a mid-bitter palate and a bit of warming alcohol.

Fra flaske på Mi2 Cardinal april-17: brunsvart med ok skum. Myk dessertaroma og -smak med stor fylde og super balanse. Mørke dessertsjokolader, litt mandarin og vanilje. Mektige saker - et lite glass er nok, en utmerket deleøl. "Dette va stiligt" (Arne). Kanskje den hadde vært enda bedre med litt mindre sødme?
Słodka likierowa doskonałość. Team słodyczka 4 life!
Shared bottle at Mi2 at Cardinal 24.04.17. Almost black. Beige head. Sweet taste of dark chocolate, vanilla and wood. Excellent!!!

UPDATED: MAY 3, 2017 W aromacie czekolada, praliny, bombonierka, trochę orzechowe, migdałowe. Do tego kawa. Ogólnie bardzo słodko, deserowo. W smaku słodkie, czekoladowe, ale nie zamulające. Są orzechy, jest kawa. Goryczka delikatna, fajnie wkomponowuje się w całość. Deserowe. Bardzo gładkie, pełne. Alkoholu nie czuć w ogóle.

From notes. 0,66l bottle at Harrys Jyväskylä, shared. Pours black colour with some amount of head. Flavor of chocolate, sweetness, biscuit, roasted malts, coffee, nuts. Smooth mouthfeel, balancing bitterness. ABV is totally hidden. Great complex beer.

I have saved this for a good occasion. Turning 50 seemed like a good one. Lovely evening sipper b the fire with some good friends.Very dark opaque color with a fine dense beige head. Good lacing down the sides of the glass. Looks solid and inviting. Pleasant intensity in the aroma with some chocolate and espresso coming up. Creamy thick texture with a smooth carbonation level. Easy to drink. Complex and flavor full beer. New layers explored as the temperature changes. Chocolate, nutty, molasses, coffee and toffee are the most prominent flavors in my mouth. Dangerously well masked alcohol. Highly recommendable![Bottle from Systembolaget in Sweden]Rating #7500
[BGM5] Intensywne, słodkie ciastka zbalansowane kawową goryczką. Bardzo pijalne. Posmak słodki, ale nie klejący, świetne piwo.
Pite na BGM, podane za chłodne. Po ogrzaniu troskzę lekki, ale fajny aromat, w smaku #teamsłodyczka, ale złożona, po prostu urwau

Cudowny czekoladowy aromat i smak.
Alkohol w tym piwie nie jest odczuwalny.
Piwo cudowne, g?ste i bardzo mocno czekoladowe.

Aroma: Malt and chocolate with ripe fruits. 
Flavour: sweet berries and chocolate with malt and coffee. Aftertaste is fruity and alcoholic warm like port with a malty twist. Mouthfeel is creamy and warm. 
Colour: Black with a fading tan head.

Bottle 65cl shared by Dominique. A dark beer with low brown head. Nose is nice on dark chocolate, dark coffee, nut notes, smooth, very pleasant, light licorice, very nice alcohol well hidden. Finish on dark chocolate, good.

Bottle. Pours deep dark brown with minimum brown head. Aroma: coffee, hayish chilly, roasted, something sour. rotten dark plums, some chocolate. Taste: medium sweet, milk chocolate, dark sugar, roasted, Sweet finish. Nice.
Butelka. Jak dla mnie wypisz wymaluj imperial biscotti break. Duzo migdałów, czekolady. Konsystencja oleista. Swietne piwo.
(FROM TAP). Extremely smooth, dark and without any fizz. Aroma of a coffee-chocolate cake. Very sweet. Alcohol non present. Fine IP.

Aroma: Cookies, chocolate, rum, fruit, flowers, cocoa. Appearance: Black body, low creamy head. Taste: Cookies, sweet chocolate, cocoa, rum, caramel, very complex and balanced. Palate: Sweet finish, low carbonation, high body.

Bottle from systembolaget Sweden. Tiny brown head. Almost totally black color. Huge chocolate aroma with a touch of cinnamon and dough. Sweet chocolate taste with a firm bitterness to balance. Very intense taste. More a sipping beer than a big drinkabillity.

Nie wiem jak smakują amerykańskie pączki a chyba one są tu matrycą, ale piwo jest naprawdę piękne. Piłem tylko 0,25 l i w takiej dawce pijalnosc była super mimo dużej słodyczy i takiej... tłustości tego piwa. Ja tam czuję przede wszystkim migdały, czekoladę, ciasto. Ale w tej całej słodyczy i deserowości piwo ma jakąś taką szlachetność, idealny balans. 11.5 % alkoholu jest tu wspaniale przykryte, a piwo wyrywa z butów.

Aroma: Awesome! Mudcake, chocolate, cocoa and sweet. Great.
Taste: Dark chocolate, cocoa. Nice and sweet.

A small taste from a friend (bottle) @ One Pint Pub. Pours very dark brown with a low tan head. Aroma is sweet roasted malts with some dough and chocolate. Flavor is sweet roasted malts, alcohol, chocolate and some hops. Quite good.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2017 Pours dark, opaque, minimal head. Strong cocoa aroma. Almonds, coffee, pralines, poppey seeds. Dessert one. At first touch of biterness completed with melty dark chocolate sweetness. Oily, low carbonation.

On tap @ Six Roses, Lille - FR. Color: deep dark black beer with no carbonation and medium creamy brown head. Smell: sweet caramel and biscuit with chocolate and mocha notes. Taste: full body with creamy sensation. Roasted malt, chocolate and mocha notes. Sweet biscuit. Good attenuation. Very drinkable for this style. Aftertaste: sweet and mocha with biscuit finish.
Sort Imp. Stout med brunt skum, der falder hurtigt. Velintegreret sødme til en fin maltkrop.

Draught, drank from the snifter. 

Aroma: chocolate, coffee, a little roastiness, dark break.

Pours pitch black, like an engine oil (very dense) with thick small head.

Tastes like a filling of a doughnut - jammy, with a hint of rose. A little bit of chocolate and dark bread as well. Heavy sweetness, medium bitterness.

Very full and thick beer. Oily, creamy. Soft carbonation.

A world class imperial porter.

Simply my favorite imperial porter. Rich aroma of vanilla and coffee alongside a perfectly balanced flavor and a literally invisible alcohol content make this one of the best beers out there. And it does taste like doughnuts!!!

Likierowato, czekoladowo i słodko. Bardzo intensywnie. Piana drobna, ledwie widoczna, trzyma się do ostatniego łyku. W smaku bogato - czekolada, likier, kawa, trochę migdałów i marcepanu. Dobrze że nie jest na tyle słodkie jak zapowiadał aromat, jest świetnie zbalansowane. Alkohol minimalnie wyczuwalny, ale nie przeszkadza, przyjemnie rozgrzewa.

Aroma: coffee, chocolate, caramel, nuts, some fruity notes
Taste: medium sweet, light bitter, coffee, chocolate, caramel, nuts

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate, mocha, roasted malts and coffee.

Appearance:

Opaque black beer with a slight brown head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, caramel, vanilla, chocolate and mocha; ends slightly bitter and dry with roasted malts and coffee.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. I can totally understand that the original beer is an Imperial Stout. That added doughnut brings a familiair sugary taste, adding some vanilla on the way and further deepening the chocolate and mocha. The aroma could have been stronger though.
LCI. Poured from the bottle. Awesome imp porter, with taste of roasted malts, cookie, chocolate and coffee, almonds. Thick bodied. Very good!

Dark brown/black with brown head. Lots of nice aroma of chocolate, caramel, bread and alcohol. The taste has lots of sweetness but balanced by a medium bitterness. Lots of cocoa notes in the flavor. Full bodied and a nice oily palate with a nice prickly carbonation on the tongue though it looks to be low on carbonation in the glass. Really nice porter!

mperial doughnut break - Eviltwin brewing 
Zapach sezamki, czekolada, palonosc 
Smak tez sezamki, fajne czekoladowe, miodowe, słodkie, w posmaku chlebek
Przyjemne piwko.

Where and how:  bottle 650 ml, - tasting 
Aroma: alcohol, molasses, hot peppers, dark coffee, hint of bubble gum and raisins 7+ 
 Appearance : 
Top: smaller top, some lace and rings on glass.
Base: clear?, brownish-black.
Palate :  medium full bodied, good depth, longer finish.
Taste:front sweet with smoky peppers, molasses, plenty of coffee. Finishing with chocolate and vodka.
Bottle. Pours black, with nice, dense brown head. Aromas of chocolate sweets. nuts, vanilla, coffee. Sweet, with marked bitterness. Smooth, with soft carbonation. Very good beer.

Aromat mega s?odki, czekolada, p?czki, cukierki kuku?ki. Troche alkoholu. Barwa ciemno br?zowa do czarnej. Piana br?zowa, obfita ale ma?o trwa?a. W smaku jak w aromacie. Goryczke przykrywa s?odycz. Kr?g?a pe?nia, umiarkowane wysycenie I s?odki, alkoholowy finisz. Bardzo dobre i pijalne cho? dla wielu zbyt s?odkie.
UPDATED: MAY 8, 2017 Czekolada, miód, trochę paloności, sezamki, lekka suszona śliwka, mocno słodki, z charakteru bardziej stout, niż porter.

Back log. Clear Jet black, beige head. In nose hudge aroma chocolate, a little bit of coffee, roasty. In taste a lot of chocollate, sweetnees similar to doughnut frosting, coffee in finish. Massive body, oily feel, creamy, soft carbonation.
Czekolada, paloność, sezamki, słodkie. Alkohol niewyczuwalny, czekolada zostaje na wargach po przełknięciu.

deep dark brown colour, moderate sized, dense brown head; aroma of dark chocolate, coffee, pecan nut,burnt woody notes and hints of vanilla; taste of dark chocolate, candied walnut and pecan, coffee and some vanilla; excellent!
Bottle. Black with small head. Aroma of coffee and hazelnut. Taste of chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Sweet.

Czarne, nieprzejrzyste z drobną, beżową pianą, która redukuje się do cienkiej, trwałej warstwy. W aromacie sporo się dzieje, jest trochę nut kawowych, czekoladowych, a także migdałów no i paloność. Smak pełny, gładki, wychodzi przyjemny posmak kawy, trochę włoskich orzechów, nuty karmelowe. Nie czuć alkoholu.

Bottle at tasting. Aroma of sweat creamy vanilla, marshmellow and chocolate. Taste has sweet marshmellows, yeats, creamy roasted malt, booze, milk chocolate, creamy coffee, soft nuts and a sweet finish. Great dessert beer.
Decent beer. Full and sweet. Aroma nad taste dominated by nuts and coffee, but its more like coffee dregs, not coffee beans. I expected a bit more from this beer.

UPDATED: APR 3, 2017 From tap @Weźże Krafta.

33cl. Flawless aroma with nuts, honey, chocolate, caramel, a bit roasty. Taste is great, like a dessert cake, sweet and full, heavy. Brownish black colour with tanned, quickly disappearing head. Overall amazing, great for a quick dessert, though finish a whole bottle could be challenging as its very, very sweet.

Kolor: czarny, nieprzejrzysty, lekko zamglony.
Piana: niska, drobnopęcherzykowa, sycząca, szybko znika. 
Zapach: słodki, karmelowy, trochę ciemne owoce, trochę melanoidym, lekka czekolada, dość sporo aromatów orzechów, włoskich, laskowych, lekkie pistacje, wyczuwalny lekki alkohol, jak na imperialny porter nie ma szału.
Smak: lekka pełnia, dość gładkie, trochę słodyczy, wyraźne nuty ciemnych owoców, trochę czekolady, melanoidyn, nut przypiekanych, dość wyraźne nuty orzechów jak w aromacie, goryczka średnia, lekko palona, kawowa, alkohol delikatny, nie przeszkadza.
Wysycenie: w kierunku niskiego, lekko szczypiące.

Aromat słodki, czekolada, orzechy włoskie, migdały.
W smaku pełne, gęste i słodkie. Bardzo czekoladowe, z nutami orzechowymi i alkoholowym rozgrzewaniem. Spodziewać się można, że to co dobre w tym piwie pochodzi od aromatów :(
Zdecydowanie #teamslodyczka. Retronosowo trochę alkohol wyłazi. Gęste, mocno lepkie. Fajnie zgrywa się palność ze słodyczą. Ale 0,65 samemu to trochę jednak dużo.. :)

Beeroda.hu Tasting Session @ Budapest.

Pours a deep brown to black with a half finger of head that dissipates quickly. Chewy brownies, liquid fudge. Tons of coffee and doughnuts. Creamy. Low bitterness, rich and full-bodied finish that lingers.

Bottle 0,65. Pours black with medium long lasting beige head. Aroma of malts, cocoa, vanilla, brown sugar, dark berries, caramel or syrup. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malts, sugar, berries, some coffee, warming alcohol Full body, oily texture, soft carbonation.
Thick and near black. Aroma is vanilla, fudgy chocolate, nutty and slightly fruity. Lots of fudge flavour, vanilla is not very strong, almond milk, coffee. Pretty good overall.

Tap. Fermentoren, Copenhagen. Nearly black. Slim ring of tan head. Nose has lots of caramel and vanilla fudge. Some amaretti. Some coconut milk. Missus gets some blackcurrant. Taste has a lactic, caramel sweetness. Pretty woody, and a bit earthy on top of that. Full body. Slick and smooth. Earthy finish. Sticky sweet lips thoughout.

Deep black in color with a dark tan colored head. Sweet chocolate aroma. Sweet chocolate flavor, pretty straight forward and delicious.

Notes: 16 bottle opened in Jan 17

Poured into a tulip, the appearance was a pure black color. Even poured like motor oil. Good two fingers worth of off white to tan foamy head. Semi-thick foamy lace clings nicely.
The aroma starts off with a huge sweet fudgey rugged sugary coated doughy cake-like feature. Thick milk chocolate chip.
The flavor yields to the sweet side with some roastiness underneath, Thick sweet milk chocolate aftertaste strolling into the finish. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a nice sipping quality over a good carbonation. Not syrupy, but a good ABV seems to feel good over the sweetness and roasty feels.
Overall, very well constructed imperial stout that I would have again.
Dark brown body with a thin brown head. Aroma is strong chocolate, malt, some ripe fruit. Taste is heavy sweet and light bitter. Oily texture, soft carbonation, full body.
0.5 draft @ Fermentoren   Aroma of coffee and milk the taste is exactly the same. It seems very genuine. A pleasant creamy and thick texture. Rather sweetish but good.

From tap at Weźże Krafta, Kraków. Aroma is vanilla, candied chocolate, tiramisu, dark malt, fudge, cocoa powder, creme brulee, marzipan. Flavour is heavy candied sweetness. Body is full and rich. Big dessert doughnut extravaganza, very nice.

Bottle at home. Pitch black colour, small darkbrown head. Nose is roasted, light coffee booze, light marzepan. Taste is low bitterness low sweetness. Smooth palate. Light marzepan and coffee in the taste as well.

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2017 Tap @ basement beer bar Aalborg. Aroma of sweet dark chocolate and coffee, vanilla. Black with tan head, mostly diminishing. Taste is heavy sweet and moderate malt bitter. Full body, creamy thick body, sweet finish.

Pours black, very thick and syrupy, with a small head.
Nose shows biscuity malt, liquorice, cocoa, soft booze and coffee liqueur.
Flavours include sweet liquorice, biscuity malt, cocoa. Quite sweet. Very sweet. A little cloying.

tap/weźże. czarne jak węgiel, nieprzejrzyste, z brązową, drobnopęcherzykową pianą utrzymującą się w postaci obfitej czapki. po czasie redukuje się do kilkumilimetrowego, drobnego krążka. aromat mlecznej czekolady, śliwki w czekoladzie, słodów palonych, ciasta czekoladowego, po ogrzaniu przyjemnie świdrujący w nosie alkohol. w smaku głównie słodkie, na finiszu kwaśne. pełne, tekstura niezwykle gładka, nieznacznie oblepiająca, nasycenie w punkt. alkohol niewyczuwalny, przyjemnie rozgrzewa. bardzo dobre piwo, choć w smaku lepsze niż w aromacie

(on tap)
Aroma:nuts,vanilla,dark malts,intensive dark chocolate,cacao.
Appearance:black color,dense brown head with nice lacing.
Taste:sweet,flavour of nuts,fudge,milk chocolate and coffee,vanilla finish.
Palate:full body,low carbonation,thick texture,
Overall:NIce fudgy creamy brew, Yummy!

Kolor:  Czarny, nieprzejrzysty. 
 Piana:  Ciemno beżowa, już prawie brązowa. Składa się z małych i średnich pęcherzyków powietrza.
Po przelaniu do wysokiego szkła udało się uformować spory kopczyk.
Piana po kilku minutach opadła do krótkiej otoczki.
Opadając pozostawiła zawiłe wstęgi na ściankach.
Po zakręceniu szkłem można zaobserwować płaczący deszcz kropelek spływających w dół po szkle. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest pierwszorzędny. Nie bez powodów przywołuje skojarzenie z Imperial Biscotti Break.
Jest słodko z wyraźną nutą kawy cappuccino, czekolady nadziewanej, orzechów migdałowych, karmelu, wanilii i oczywiście tych słynnych amerykańskich pączków.
Alkohol delikatnie wyczuwalny, ale daje bardziej nuty ciasta nasączanego mocnym trunkiem. 
 Smak:  W smaku niesamowicie słodowe. Masa nut pączków w czekoladzie, czekolady deserowej, muffinków, karmelu, migdałów, kawy z mlekiem, ciasteczek typu "cookie" z drobinkami czekoladowymi.
W tle kakao, szczypta wanilii i melasy.
Niesamowita gładkość, kremowe odczucie w ustach.
Na prawdę dawno nie piłem tak aksamitnego piwa.
Procenty po mistrzowsku zamaskowane. Tekstura pełna, trunek gęsty i oleisty.
Nic dodać, nic ująć, po prostu fenomenalny deser. 
 Wysycenie:  Niskie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

Oryginalny i nieprawdopodobnie gładki Imperial Porter. I tak na prawdę mam to gdzieś, że dodano do niego sztucznych aromatów. Dla mnie piwo pachnie i smakuje jak prawdziwy amerykański pączek z dziurką, oblany gęstą czekoladą i z kolorową posypką cukierkową.
Imperial Doughnut Break jest wielowarstwowym trunkiem. Łączy w sobie cechy klasycznego Imperialnego Porteru (kawa, czekolada, ciasteczka, słody) z domieszkami wanilii, kakao, orzechów migdałowych i muffinów.
Duża butla (650 ml) trunku znika w oczach i to jest najlepszą reklamą dla tego piwa.
Rewelacja!

Piana śladowa. W aromacie bardzo słodko, czekolada, lukrecja, minimalny akcent ciemnych owoców. W smaku średnio gęste, słodkie, a słodycz tylko zwiększa się ku finiszowi, który jest wręcz lukrowy. Dalej trochę ciemnych owoców. Na plus nieźle ukryty alkohol, który momentami jest odczuwalny, ale prawie wcale nie przeszkadza. Na prawdę niezłe piwo, widocznie lepsze od pitego przeze mnie na początku roku puszkowego imperial biscotti break.

Draught
Aroma-chocolate, caramel, 
Appearance-black, hazy, brown foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-full body, creamy, average carbonation, long finish, 
Palate-very good, very drinkable

Piana ciemna, sycząca, szybko znika do zera. Barwa czarna z brązowym refleksie u dołu. Faktycznie, obok czekolady. pralin i kawy, jest tu nutka słodkiego ciasta (pączków?) w zapachu... W smaku słodkie, wyklejające, intensywnie czekoladowe, kawowe, do tego znów ciasto (raczej murzynek niż pączek), jakieś rumowe i śliwkowe posmaki... Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie, pełne, ale nie gęste w odbiorze. Alkohol przyjemnie rozgrzewający.

Całkiem charakterny trunek, może nie tak dobry jak Imperial Biscotti Break, aczkolwiek widać, że naturalne aromaty dodają pazura...

Appearance: opaque black with no relief, one fat finger of dense dark beige head, good retention and moderate lacing. (5/5) Aroma: cocoa, lactose, coffee, vanilla. (8/10) Taste: moderate-high sweet, moderate-high bitter. (7/10) Palate: full viscous body, moderate-high carbonation, lingering bitter and mildly warming finish. (4/5)

Woof - what a beast. Basically a coffee and doughnut milkshake, with a seriously sneaky double digit ABV. When I say a mildly warming finish, I mean it: youll be most of the way through your first pint before you realize how hard its hitting you. Cant find a reliable source for the IBU, but its gotta be 50+. However, given the sweetness and body for this thing, thats completely appropriate - recommended. (16/20)
Evil Twin Imperial Doughnut Break - aromat słodki, deserowy, nuta alkoholu. Smak słodki, lekko alkoholowy, paczki, lukier, ciastka. Niestety jeszcze musi trochę poleżeć.

Huj z paczkami, wazne ze cala reszta bardzo stoutowo rzecz biorac sympatyczna... acz ciut gorszy nadal od jesusow, biscottich i reszty klasy
Mogłoby się trochę ułożyć, alkohol jednak wyraźny, zwłaszcza w aromacie. Ale bardzo fajna słodycz, czekolada, ciemne owoce.
W aromacie kawa, czekolada, lukrowa słodycz. W smaku wyczuwalna kawa, czekolada i pączki z lukrem.

Black colour with a small tan head. Coffee, sweetness, chocolate, truly dessert.
Shared 22oz. bottle. Pours almost black with a tan head. Roasty aroma. Taste is roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, vanilla notes. Good.

Bottle shared on NYE at Big Mikes. Poured a thicker body deep black with a smaller tight foamy beige head. Aroma/flavor of burnt malts, vanilla, dark chocolate, burnt toast, ash. Thicker syrupy body, medium to lighter carbonation, syrupy finish, no heat at all.

Bottle shared with Linh and Scarlett in Madison, GA. Pours a deep brown body with thin ring of tan lacing. Nose is sweet sugar, brownie, chocolate and vanilla. Mouthfeel is medium to light bodied with notes of sugary chocolate syrup, light roast, tons of sweet sugar, lactose, alcohol character and melted brownie.
Duft ristet malt svag kaffe chokolade sød smag chokolade kaffe vanilje kage svag ristet malt

0,65 l bottle 
caramel, vanilla, chocolate, coffee, black, hazy, frothy, brown foam, medium sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, oily feel, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,

650ml bottle. Pours an opaque black with a small, creamy, long lasting, brown head that laces. Sweet aroma of roasted malt, dark chocolate, coffee and vanilla. Sweet flavour of roasted malt, dark chocolate, toffee, molasses, coffee and vanilla with warming alcohol in a dry finish. Full body with a thick, creamy, smooth, oily texture and soft carbonation. Delicious.

Aroma: lots of vanilla and some coffee; Appearance: pitch black with thin white head that disappears quickly; Taste: cloyingly sweet with much less flavor and complexity than expected; Palate: heavy body with long, sweet finish; Overall: okay but definitely disappointing. Would not get again.

Bomber shared. Pours a deep brown to black with a half finger of head that dissipates quickly. Chewy brownies, liquid fudge. Tons of coffee and doughnuts. Creamy. Low bitterness, rich and full-bodied finish that lingers.

Dark chocolate and big dark fruit aromas. As it warms some vanilla and chocolate glaze appears. Taste is dark chocolate and dark fruits, mild roasted malts, and some vanilla bean in the end. After some time to warm, vanilla becomes more prevalent in the middle and finish. The biscotti flavors also resurge in the beginning and middle after it warmed.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2017 Pours black, slightly clear, with foamy light brown head. Aroma: intense malt note, which takes on coffee, milk & dark chocolate, hazelnuts, cocoa powder, some almond...flavor is very similar, with prevailing malt flavors, mentioned above, supported with hint of vanilla, roasted.. Finish is slightly bitter (roasted & hops; spicy, peppery notes). Body is thick, texture velvetly, carbo low to medium.
UPDATED: DEC 27, 2016 .65l bottle @Harry?s. Pours black with medium beige head. Aroma is dark malts, vanilla, chocolate, milk coffee, syrup, alcohol, leather, caramel, . Flavor is mostly same! Swell!

Bottle; pours black with a thin ring of mocha colored head; aroma of chocolate, roasted malt, molasses, and vanilla; taste is sweet but not a sweet as I was expecting after reading the label with chocolate, molasses, vanilla, and some roast malt notes; finish is dry and bittersweet with some chocolate hints
Chocolate brown head, fades quickly. Body medium to full. Lots in there: light coffee, nut, sherry, nettle, toffee, berries.

Bottle for breakfast with MF666 before Hvidovre IF - BK Frem. Black with a small light brown head. Sweet and soft, candy, chocolate, roasted malt and vanilla. Full body, oily texture, medium/heavy sweet and bitter. Malty finish with roasted malt and chocolate. Warming alcohol. Ok.

Pours ebony, no carbonation or head. Aroma is chocolate, roasted malts, some coffee. Flavour explodes in its complexity: chocolate fudge, nuts, coffee (strong), dark malts. Bready in the end with the doughnuts that make their solid appearance. Medium body, very low carbonation and moderated bitterness. A great sipper!
Aroma: dark chocolate muffin, deep rich coffee, burnt brown sugar. Taste: liquorice, dark chocolate, espresso bean, butter finish. Thick Mouth feel. Overall: this is something special. Enjoy.
Dark mocha brown pour lovely tan foam. Spicy coffee aroma. Taste - treacle, mild coffee, mild dark malt on finish.
Nice aroma of booze, chocolate, vanilla and cake. Ebony color. Nice sweetness up front. Dark chocolate, vanilla hint of cinnamon and a nice boozy burn. Dry finish. Really nice.

Javais un peu peur vue la Biscotti. Mais la cest du bon !
Nez : au debut éthylique, puis rapidement chocolat, café, caramel.
Bouche : ronde, gourmande, un peu grasse mais chocolaté, un peu café, un joli caramel. Le cote doughnut se sent tres bien dans la finale et la longueur. Un cote un peu pâteux et dessert.
Miam.
Black treacle appearance with a caramel brown head. Rich tasting of complexed combination of dark chocolate, molasses, cherries & slight doughnut. Boozy ever changing rewarding beer.

Bottle shared at deansos. Pitch black with an espresso head. Notes of caramel, cinnamon, vanilla, milk chocolate, cocoa, some cherries. Medium body, low carbonation and a bitter-sweet and slightly alcoholic finish.

Shared from bottle at deansos. Black with tan head. Big sweet roasted smooth chocolate malts, hazelnut, mocha, coffee and dark fruity notes. Sweet malts, vanilla, dough batter. Big sweet and light chocolate bitter. About full body, soft carbonation. Sweet chocolatey, roasty and fruity finish.

Bottle shared thanks to sjogro. Almost black with nice creamy brown head. Lots of vanilla, milk chocolate, light booze, red apple, molasses, fudge. Over medium sweet and medium bitter. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

Bottle at surprise tasting at Brewcraft - thanks guys. Opaque black pour. Dark dark brown head. Aroma is sweet chocolate and musty. Taste is surprisingly sharp and tart. Not that deep doughnut sweetness I was expecting like biscotti break or something. Quite bitter. Booze is big of course. Aroma better than taste I think.
Bottled. Pours black. The smell is sweet and roasty. The plate is thick and creamy. The taste is sweet. Has a sweet roasty toffee taste. With a chocolate sweet taste.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Perfectly black, rich beige head. Chocolaty nose with some ash. Sweet with full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Sweet bread, toffee, ash and chocolate. Dusty bitterish finish. Less harmonious than the Biscotti series. Also somewhat less sweet.
Negro opaco y espuma beis. Aromas de bizcocho dulce, glaseado, chocolate, café. Cuerpo denso y sabor como en aroma y final de amargor tostado hasta el regusto.

Pitch black color. Tons of vanilla, sweet chocolate chip, molasses, licorice, tons of cookies. Complete dessert beer. Over the top. Not bad but just too sweet,
Though not cloying.

Bomber at a bottle share. Nose is chocolate, hot canola oil used to fry the doughnuts, and a doughy note 
Black with a small beige head. Flavor is big chocolate and vanilla. Pretty nice.

On tap at Harrys Hofbrau in Redwood City, CA. Aroma is sweet almond liqueur (Amaretto), dark chocolate, maybe chocolate covered cherries, bready, almond biscotti. Taste is sweet, almond, dark chocolate covered cherries, chocolate covered espresso beans. Very sweet but somehow not overly so...amazing dark chocolate porter-y tanginess. Reminded me of a less almond-y or slightly more chocolately version of Evil Twin Imperial Biscotti Break.

Bottle to pint glass

A couple minutes later this was poured and I began celebrations. Fuck this is good. Lots of soy, motor oil, treacle, brown sugar, roasted malt and a hint of raspberry
Adjunct: Smells like a caramel glazed chocolate doughnut; silky black with a 2 cm, very creamy, light brown head; very smooth and thick with a touch of booziness
75ml bottle. Good black/chocolate color, with a dark foam. Very very sweet and you immediately get the sugar taste from the glaze. This dominates pretty much everything else.

Bottled. Pours black with an average tan head. Aroma of roasted malt, chocolate, bready notes, brown sugar and dark fruit notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and slightly bitter. A very nice Porter indeed. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Draught at Bootleggers Craft Beer Bar, Copenhagen. Pitch black with a thin, tanned head. Sweet aroma with rich, dark malts, chocolate, coffee, caramel malts, liquorice and soy sauce. Really greasy. Taste is roasted sweet. Full body with an oily texture and a soft carbonation. Finishes lasting roasted dry and bitter with lingering dark malts. Excellent Porter.

650 ml bottle. Pours a black tar with moderate dark head. Aromas of thick muddy coffee, dark chocolate, smooth roasted malts, and ark Molasses. Flavors of rich dark chocolate, sugary dough, sweetened coffee, and more smooth roasted malts. Super stuff. But a porter?

Stor, tung kropp. I princip ingen kolsyra, nästan helt slät kropp. Smak av choklad, kaffe, lite svarta vinbär. Doughnuten kommer fram lite mer när den kommer upp i temperatur, men det är inte direkt supertydligt. Helt ok, men lever inte upp till förväntan.

Bottle, shared with Parksy and Grippitis and Rockley. Viscous, old motor oil pour with a slowly rising finely bubbled brown head. Sweet and rich, fudgey chocolate, espresso, vanilla cream, with a balancing acidity and bitterness. What a challenge to balance these huge sweet flavours without feeling artificial or becoming cloying. Really great.

Pours dark brown with a tan head. Aroma is hot chocolate, vanilla and toast. Taste is heavy bitter and heavy sweet.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 Large bottle from Good Beer NYC. Pitch black color, brown head. Rich aroma of roasty malts, coffee, sweet notes, chocolate, maybe that doughnut there. Full body, balanced, smooth, sweetness, coffee, hops at the end. Delicious.

Sample during the 11th Annual Day Before Labor Day Party on 09/04/2016. Pours brownish-black with a medium foamy tan head that diminishes gradually. Partial rings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of coffee, malt and actual donuts. Full-bodied with flavors of glazed donuts, malt and coffee. The finish is rich and chewy with a coffee and donut aftertaste. Good beer all around.

Black color with dark brown head. Aroma is really malty with brown sugar and chocolate cake. Taste follows with sweet, toasted malts, dark chocolate, fudge and slightly roasty finish. Full bodied with smooth mouthfeel. Really balanced and tasty with a nice mouthfeel. I dont really get donuts but didnt really expect to.

Aroma of sharp booze, chocolate, chocolate frosting, sherry, nuts. 
Pours a thick black colour with a creamy brown head. 
Taste is much better than the aroma with no booze, loads of chocolate, sherry, sweet coffee, nuts and a tad roast. Very sweet but not like syrup. 
Medium to full bodied, soft carbonation, velvety mouthfeel, slightly roasted coffee finish. I was slightly dissapointed about this one.

Bottle. Pours out pretty much black with a creamy tan head. Aroma is of liquid donut. Chocolate glaze, light coffee, syrupy sweetness, toast, light caramel, some earthy notes, milk sugar. Taste is solid, full mouthfeel, syrupy sweetness, toast, chocolate glaze, coffee, some light roast, caramel, toffee. Really sweet with some light alcohol on the finish.

Pours black with a nice tan head, recedes quickly but still laces the glass. Aroma is banana bread, cacao, vanilla beans, slightly woody, makes me wanna drink it. Taste is a fantastic medley of chocolate, frosting, oak, vanilla. A unique beer that sets out to taste like something and actually hits it.

650ml bottle pours black in color with 2 fingers of light brown head that leaves some decent lacing on the glass. Aroma is light roasted grains and chocolate with some sweet malts and hints of alcohol. Taste is a light roasted grain and hop bitterness with chocolate and sweet malts. Full bodied with modest carbonation. Overall, this is a premium example of the style. Full flavor ... check. Nice balance ... check. Suits the style ... check. Outstanding and highly recommended.

Merci à Mademoiselle Irina pour le partage. À quoi faut-il sattendre dune bière aux beignes? À rien je présume. Ou peut-être à tout. Le liquide me paraît presque noir. Quelques reflets bruns foncés et chocolatés percent péniblement la pénombre. Une mousse mi pâle mi foncée abonde lors du service avant de mourir quelques minutes minutes plus tard. Je suis ravi de constater que ma bière ne sent pas la friture à beignes. Je suis plutôt dans le glaçage au chocolat, la pâte à biscuit, le caramel et le malt rôti et il ne faut pas sen étonner non plus. Des arômes secs eurent été franchement surprenants. Je suis saisi par léquilibre que propose cette bière. Je mattendais à une lourde bombe de sucre. Or il nen est rien, ou presque. Les saveurs ont beau être toutes orientées sur la pâtisserie, le liquide est de densité et de corps très appréciables. Malgré tout ce glaçage au chocolat au lai, la torsade, la roussette au miel et le cacao, les première gorgées sont faciles à enchaîner. Cest à la longue que ça devient pénible. En se réchauffant, le lèvres me collent et mon estomac se gonfle. Un bomber convient parfaitement à 4 personnes. Hélas, nous nétions que 3.
650ml bottle, pours thick black. Light head that diminishes quick. Rich, smooth, dangerous, moderate to high roasted character, and delicious. Domin this bottle glazed me ;)

22oz bottle. Pours like motor oil. Super thin head. Very thin lacing. Kind of weak mouthfeel too. But, thats where it all stops. Amazing chocolate, coffee, cocoa nib taste. Smells of vanilla, oak, sweet pastries, coffee, leather dominate. Outstanding beer. I need to go get more of this!!!
On tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen. Pours black with brownish head. Roasted malts, chocolate, biscuit, cocoa. Sweet, with roasty bitterness. Medium to full bodied. Tasty.

Pours black as night thin tan head doughy chocolate aromas and almost a bourbon type aroma delicious chocolate, slightly, coffee, dough sweetness absolutely delicious gonna have to stash a few bottles

Égett kólaszínű teste olajos benyomást kelt, megforgatva egyértelmű lenyomatot hagy a pohár falán. A kávészerű jelleg hamar körvonalazódik a levegőben, a fahéjas, keserédes, étcsokoládés, pisztáciás jegyek is rögtön megcsillannak, átütő erőben ezúttal sincs hiány. Szirupos kortyai feszesek, "imperial" jelleghez mérten közepesen testesek, nem mázsás, inkább kilogrammban mérhető súlyúak, nem terpeszkedőek. A könnyen rámondható fánkos, fondüs karakter mellett a borítékolható csokoládés, marcipános jelleget sem nélkülözi, kirobbanó erővel azonban talán nem bír, inkább méltóságteljesen közvetíti a nyalánkságokba csomagolt mondanivalót. Mindemellett a hírnevének maradéktalanul eleget tesz, teljesebb értékű imperial portert nem könnyen találni. Mégis kicsit többet vártam tőle, így alakult ki a fenti pontszám.

On tap at Himmeriget, Copenhagen Denmark. Pitch black with a thick brown head. Aromas of coffee, chocolate, dough. Taste is sweet with chocolate, dough, caramel, plums, sweet malts. Full, chewy body with low carbonation. Pretty amazing!

Before now, I was unaware of the patented Evil Twin "dry-doughnuting" technique, but now Im a believer. Although Im sure it must be used with caution. No one wants a dry donut hole. Imperial Doughnut Break is a hearty stick-to-your-bones kind of brew. You practically chew your way through it. Its rich. You get some sugary malt character from the doughnuts. Theres also bold chocolate and coffee flavors. Im not sure your physician would recommend enjoying this with at least 2 morning doughnuts from the local bakery, but I sure as hell will.

Bottle.

A- Coffee, Doughnuts.

A- Black color, black liquid, brow head.

T- Coffee, cocoa, doughnuts, slightly sweet.

P- Full body, thick texture, average carbonation, rich finish.

O- Sure as shit I smell glazed donuts in here and it works really wells. Coffee isnt too strong but there and donuts are apparent. Very tasty and well balanced. Not as sweet as I expected. Yum!
Bottle. Pours black. Aroma and taste are roasted malts, sweet chocolate, and caramel.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 As advertised, a classic Evil Twin rich Imperial with added sweetness and breadiness as predicted by the beer name. Simple, rich, sweet and toasty. Coffee, chocolate, toffee and touches of cream and dark berries.

651 ml. bottle. Pours a thin, poorly retained beige head, with no lacing, over a clear, dark brownish black (SRM 35) body........nose is heavy roasted malts, with big and dominating chocolate, hits of cocoa, hints of coffee, light dried malt fruits, primarily raisin, no esters, mild herbal hops, balance to the malts......taste is sweet, with light brown sugar, toffee/caramel hints, heavy chocolate, light dried fruit notes, finishing almost dry, with mild hop bitterness, balance to the malts........mouth feel, heavy of medium, sticky body, alcohol warmth present, carbonation makes a creamy mouthful. This is a very sweet, roasted malt, dominated beer. The alcohol at 11.5% is remarkably well hidden by the heavy malts. The complexity in both aroma and flavor is a bit low because of the malts heavy roast hiding the hop contribution almost completely. This is a dessert beer. BJCP 7/2/12/4/6

Dark brown/black color. Aroma has dark chocolate, coffee and sweet pastries. Taste is pastries dipped in black coffee, very well balanced sweetness alongside a long, light bitter finish. The alcohol is a bit too noticable, otherwise just an excellent beer!

Black pour, small tan head - looks like oil. Aroma of sweet chocolate, darker bread, slight darker fruit. Medium to full body, sweet milk chocolate flavor dominates, oily mouthfeel.

Tap. Almost black hue, thin tan head. Roasty, some lacto sweetness, chocolate cake and some bitter chocolate and coffee in the aroma. Flavor is similar and not as sweet as I expected this to be: toasty and roasty, but cakey notes but in the more doughy sense and slight figs. Thicker viscous body. Big beer but good.

Tap Black colour with small beige head.Aroma is roasted and bready of cocoa and tar,light smoked mothfeels and nots of chocolate and caramel good full body and strong finish.

Tap @ Himmeriget. Black with small brown head. Aroma is roasted malts, caramel, sweet, sugar and bread. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, sugar, warming, dark fruit, bread, sweet, hop and medium bitter.
Bottle. Dark pour with tan head. Roasted, chocolate, sweet malty aromas. Flavors are chocolate, roasted, vanilla, sugar Flavors.

Poured black in color with a thin brown head.
Chocolate cake, cocoa, vanilla in aroma.
Sweet chocolate, canilla, chocolate pudding flavor. 
On the sweeter side, even if I like these kind of dessert brews.

Draught at Himmelriget. 
Pours heavy black. 
Aroma of syrup and chocolate 
Sweet chocolate and roasted malts.

Tap at Himmeriget. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee, vanilla, syrup, chocolate, liquorice. Boozy notes.The flavours starts sweet but finish bitter with roasted notes. The body is full and the texture is creamy.

From tap at Himmeriget. It pours opaque black with a dense creamy beige head. Sweet roasted aroma with chocolate and light coffee notes. Deep roasted flavor with a nice creamy oat feel to it. Chocolate and licorice.
Tap @ himmeriget. Black body with a small offwhite head. Caramel, roasted malt, cookie, dough, smooth.
Pours Pitch Black with a Tan head. Aroma of dark fruits, fudge, vinous, light roast, raisins. Light vanilla. Taste is heavy sweet, fudgey, slot of dark fruits and chocolate. Very enjoyable.

Tap @ Himmeriget. Black with a small brown. Aroma is sweet, roasted malt, chocolate, bready and light alcohol. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Sweet and rather bitter finish with lots warming alcohol. Oily. 120516

Tap @Himmeriget. Black with thick beige head. Roast and coffee aroma. Notes of dark syrup too. Fluffy, creamy yet solid mouthfeel. Boozy coffee flavour, caramel and syrup. Sweet and sticky with lasting bitter finish. Booze is a tad too unbalanced for my taste.
Tap at churchkey. Pours brown with lots of ruby some head and lacing. Flavours molasses, dark chocolate vanilla bourbon. Taste big sweet med bitter. Full creamy body light carb.

Sweet nose with toasted grains. Jet black color, opaque. Massive body with a range of flavors: coffee, chocolate, dark fruits, molasses. It deposits a sweet dollop of caramel on the lips. Strong alcohol that singes the throat slightly going down. This is a meal in a glass.

Breads malt nose, intense. Pitch black colored with a nice sienna head lace on top. Intense coffee, chocolate, caramel and syrup taste. Long lingering light bitter aftertaste, pleasant ! Thick and oily consistency!

Draft. A black beer with a dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt, chocolate, and alcohol. The flavor is sweet with notes of chocolate, sugar, roasted malt, and alcohol, leading to a dry roasted finish.
Tap at Taphouse pitch dark small Brown head. Aroma is roasted malty. Dry. Flavor is lots of roasted malts also lots of woody notes
From tap at Taphouse. Black with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of roasted malt, chocolate, caramel, licorice, alcohol and bitterness.

Bottle:
Oily black with a dark brown head.
Aroma is slightly boozy, dark chocolate cake.
Taste is sweet, sugary, chocolate malt, light doughnut glaze, cream, sweet dark coffee roast.
Nice and chewy.....
Fantastic.

Catch up rating from RIS tasting last night. Pours out normal black body capped with a small head Aroma leads into lots of sweet notes, some chocolate, some molasses. Flavor is more of the roast grain and of course, chocolate doughnuts.
Boise Imperial Stout Tasting, dark brown pour topped with a small brown head. Sweet chocolate and boozy, lots of rich chocolate and vanilla. Just a little bit of roast, mostly sweet desert decadence.

Decadent boozy and slightly over-roasty flavor of dark chocolate, a bit of roast, and fresh glazed bready doughnuts. Doesnt quite come together as magically as hoped, its pretty bready and plain-doughnuty, but its quite boozy and chocolaty so that makes up for it. Unfortunately its also a tad too roasty which lends a bit of bitterness.
Bottle pours black topped with a small head. nose is nice big sweetness chocolate molasses. Taste is more of the heavy roast chocolate vanilla brownies and doughnuts.
On the Brick Store Pub cellared sampler. Black. Lots of lacing. Aroma and taste of dark chocolate, licorice, and roasted malts. Sweet. Medium full mouthfeel.

T: light smoky malts. Licorice. Pretty roasted with a fairly high bitterness.

Very thick dark pour with a faint smell of coffee. Good roast flavors and coffee notes. Very tasty but lacking complexity for the price of this beer.

22oz bottle. Black color with a brown head. Roasted malt caramel chocolate coffee aroma. Coffee roasted malt alcohol flavor. Medium heavy body.

chocolate, roasty, coffee, caramel, dough, black, hazy, brown foam, heavy cloying sweetness, lightly bitter, full body, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish, almost so balanced it becomes boring. Want more complexity but still an excellent beer

A: Intense black body; dark mocha head. Lacing.

Poured from bottle into a snifter
 Appearance  The beer pours a super deep brown color with a one finger of tan colored head. The head has a fantastic level of retention, slowly fading to leave a great level of foamy lace on the sides of the glass. Swirling the brew in the snifter shows its very thick nature, with fingers of a thick syrupy look clinging to the sides of the glass before slowly receding back to the bottom of the vessel.
 Smell  The aroma of the beer is quite heavy of a roasted malt smell with a good showing of a coffee and chocolate as may have been anticipated from the name and look of the brew. Some aromas of a more sweet crème like nature as well as some caramel and darker fruits are present as well, all brining a strong level of sweetness to the nose. Along with these aromas so to come smells of a hot boozy nature, which overall mix with the others to create a sweet, dark, and warming smell of booze laden chocolate latte.
 Taste  The taste begins of a huge sweet flavor of tons of caramel and chocolate flavors as well as a good showing of a malty dark roasted taste. As the flavor advances, even more milk chocolate like flavors come to the tongue, with the milk chocolate becoming one of the more dominate tastes in the profile and brining an even higher level of sweetness to the brew. Some coffee develops on the tongue as it advances toward the end with other dark fruit tastes of fig and raisin developing more toward the end as well. A little bit more roasted malt flavor and some sweet crème flavors come to the tongue at the end with a decent showing of a slightly bourbon boozy taste as well as some light char. All these flavors in the end, mingle together to leave a rather thick cloyingly sweet and heavy chocolate latte flavor to linger on the tongue. 
 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the very full and creamy with a carbonation level that was actually a little bit on the higher side then I would have anticipated. The thick body really accentuated the sweet flavors of the brew, almost to the point to where they were too potent. It was however, somewhat appropriate for the roasted and thick imperial porter style though. While a higher carbonation is not usually appropriate for an imperial porter, for this one, it actually was rather nice, as it did help subdue the thick syrupy sweetness and kept to boozy flavors form being all that overpowering. Overall that feel was pretty good for making this a more drinkable brew.
 Overall  A bit too cloyingly sweet and thick for my taste. It has some decent darker flavors, but these are just sorta lost in some of the massive sweetness. If only this was fermented down a bit more, then I think it would be a very enjoyable brew. But as stands, for the price this is one to shy away from.

The flavor is sweet and rich with a full chocolate cake of brownie batter flavors through out the sip. Solid amount of roasted malt, vanilla and burnt sugar. Rich and decadent, imperial porter that I would think was an imperial stout, no matter the classification because this is solid.

Un liquide presque noir avec une petite mais performante mousse kaki. Les parfums de sucre vanillé, de chocolat, de café fort, de caramel, de pâte damandes et de fruits foncés appellent directement une première gorgée. En bouche, contre toute attente, ce mélange unique nest pas si sucré. La torréfaction et les notes rôties y jouent un rôle important. Donc, parmi les délicieuses saveurs de malts et de pâtisserie, la présence salvatrice de la robuste combinaison café et céréales rôties. Au palais, le corps costaud est judicieusement touché par des bulles actives. La texture, quant à elle, est bellement crémeuse comme un verre de lait entier. La finale nest jamais chaude (mais où se cache ce 11.5%?) ni douce mais rendue bien amère par la torréfaction et le traitement rôti. Bière calorique bue avec Frank.

text: Bomber from Rays in Tosa, cellar aged about 2 months. Served at cellar temperature for the first glass, then cooler from refrigerating for the second. Pours opaque black with almost no head. Swirling gets faint cafe au lait streaks in the top. Very lowly carbonated. Aroma has bakers chocolate ... and more bakers chocolate. Plus some espresso and sweet caramel. Later in the glass some lactose shows through, along with some alcoholly aroma. Concentrating gets a "glazed doughnut" sugary-ness. Very nice - strong - chocolate/coffee/caramel blend. Taste is of bitter bakers chocolate, sweet caramel, bitter espresso, sweet lactose, with sugar. Very interesting in that it rots the teeth from the sweetness, yet has such a strong bitter component. Did it ever get cloying, well, perhaps at some points during the glass. Medium to full bodied with a bit of alcohol. Finishes quite long, and more sweet than bitter, but the bitter, with alcohol, does fight to keep balance. An interesting take on a very good brew. Personally, zero chance this is a stout, as it comes off a porter base, and says "imperial porter" on the bottle - plus would be far sweeter than any stout had to date. Solid tasty brew. The aroma would have made a super-terrific beer, but is not followed through - perhaps as the sweetness from the "doughnuts" is stronger in the flavor. The cherry Natale was better as a knockoff from the base.

22 oz bottle. Dark brown with a fluffy tan head. Nose is chocolate, coffee, hay and cane sugar. Medium body with a tang. Taste is cocoa, coffee, almond and dates with a burnt sugar finish.
On tap at Beercraft. Pours a black color with a lot of brown head that dissipates quickly. Mild chocolate and a bit of hoppiness. Some bitter coffee at the end. Not so sweet.

Inky black pour with one finger of chestnut brown head. Rich nose, chocolate notes big time with some sweet icing character and burnt malt. Lightly woody. Dark chocolate and smooth burnt sugar. Weird flavor on the finish. Full bodied with warming alcohol

Keg at Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell, London. A dark brown/black coloured pour with a thin beige head on top. Rich, sweet, vanilla, chocolate aroma. Tastes similar, rich, sweet, vanilla, chocolate, caramel. Not getting much in the way of doughnuts in this but still a great novelty beer.

At jacobs with group. Pour is black with brown lacing. Aroma is big authentic chocolate, frosting. Taste is cocoa powder, dark chocolate bar, huge awesome chocolate notes that are delicious and last a long time. A fantastic beer.

On tap at Beercraft. Pours black with a hot chocolate head. Aroma is quite nice, loaded with French vanilla and graham crackers. Flavor is a step down, chocolate syrup with a tinge of hazelnut, I guess I can see the sweet doughiness but its minor. Body is kinda airy and silky, a bit too light.

Draft at Sams quik shop. Pours black with a thin khaki head. Rich notes of coffee, chocolate, and lactose on the nose. Very big on the tongue with some alcohol burn. Lots of roasted malt with all of the sweetness theyve added. Somehow it balances. Somehow it works. Definitely one to savor and not slurp down as quickly as I did.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2015 Draft in a taster at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a deep opaque brown with a small beige head that settles into a ring. Notes of vanilla, molasses, dark and milk chocolate, roast, earth, cacao nibs, and brown sugar. Medium-bodied, with low to moderate carbonation and a smooth, rich, and sweet mouthfeel. Draft to taster at 8ball. Pours opaque dark brown. Nose dark bakers chocolate, roast, faint coffee. Tatse sweet up front, then strong mid palate bitter and roast. Chocolate flavors in mid. Glazed sweet in early finish fading to nice roasty bitter finish.

Weighing in at 11.5% and calling itself an imperial porter... not sure why this is classified as a "sweet stout". Admins gotta justify themselves, I guess. Anyway, pours a very thick and viscous pitch black with almost no head, but what head there is presents itself as light brown. Aromas of morning roll call at the local Iowa police precinct...coffee and doughnuts on every fat cops breath. Taste is sweet and mildly bitter from the malt. Flavors of coffee, heavily roasted malt, a touch of jelly doughnut filling. Thick mouthfeel, very filling and round. No sharp edges here. Finish is sticky sweet and very heavily roasted but surprisingly not cloying at all. Normally I dont like my impy stouts so sweet but this all comes together so nicely Ill give it a pass. Top fucken notch.

Tap at hops and pie. Clear dark brown with a small, brown head. Aromas of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, light booze, some dark fruit. Flavor is sweet vanilla, sugar, roasted malt, light coffee, chocolate and dark fruit. Medium bodied, smooth with some warmth on the end.

On tap at Barleys in KC. Comes black with a decent tan head. Aroma of chocolate, malt, and coffee. Taste is dark chocolate, roasted malt, coffee, dark fruit, and vanilla. It is sweet, but didnt think overly so.

22oz bomber for *gulp* $18. Poured into a Sam Adams Perfect Pint. I heard their Imperial Biscotti Break was great, but it wasnt available, so I went with this hoping itd be as good.

Appearance: Pitch black with an almost orange colored head that doesnt last all-too long. Only a little bit of lacing. It looks pretty good given the ABV.

Smell: Im looking for doughnuts right away -- and theyre there, but not in a huge way. There is certainly a sort of doughy sweetness, but the huge amounts of roasted malt and chocolate sort of aromas take the forefront. A bit of that "soy sauce" sort of thing going on that I get in some really big imperials. A bit of alcohol. The nose on this just lets you know its got a high ABV. Quite nice on the nose overall, but disappointing given my expectation. Still, scoring it a 4. Truthfully though, if I werent told the name of this beer, Id probably not REALLY guess that this beer had donuts in it.

Taste/feel: Doughnuts? Actually, yes. Thankfully, they are more in the taste than in the aroma. Its more of a doughy flavor than an actual doughnut taste, but theyre certainly there. A nice full body to this beer. A surprising medium/high carbonation that actually works quite nicely. After looking back, this is labelled a porter -- that explains that. Dough flavor is there at the initial sip. A nice blend of roasted malt and coffee with a slightly burned quality then comes in afterwards, with a bittersweet mocha sort of finish. Also a slightly sour/salty-esque finish thats in some imperials. This beer is just *heavy*, but in a very good way.

Overall, I almost want to trash this beer given the price I paid, but Ill go ahead and not bother doing that. I was expecting (and actually hoping for) a beer with huge amounts of glazed doughnut flavor, but I just got a really nice imperial porter -- with some doughnuts added. Like I said, had the name of the beer not been "Imperial Doughnut Break", I wouldnt guess that doughnuts were used. There is definitely a doughy flavor, but Id not pinpoint it. Its a nice beer that Id have again, but its hard to justify the price here. Truthfully, I like this beer a bit more than my rating indicates (maybe by a quarter of a point in most categories), but its a slight let down.

22oz bomber shared by JohnGonk at my wife's 37th Birthday get together. Pours black with a creamy mocha head. Aroma of chocolate glazed doughnuts, roasted malt, and caramel. Taste of rich bitter coffee, dark chocolate, wood, leather, and caramel. This is pretty damn good!!

Pour out of 22 oz bottle, thick black pour with creamy dark tan head that lasts well, aroma brought notes of nice dark chocolate, roast, coffee, slight sweet fruity notes, some cinnamon, sweet sugary notes, pretty dough forward as well. Taste is a mix of sweet caramel, toffee, molasses, roast, milk chocolate into some cinnamon, clove, slight sweet sugar into a bit of dark fruit, finishing sweet, slightly bitter. Not really like a doughnut, but it is very tasty.

UPDATED: APR 14, 2014 22oz bottle pours oily black with a finger of mocha head. Nose is sweet brownie batter, hershey syrup, roasty chocolate. Taste is creamy chocolate cake, brownie, roasty coffee, almond, cocoa, booze. Finish is slick sticky sweet chocolate cake, roasty smoked nuts, hints of fried dough, a bit boozy.
A dark, bittersweet, bready chocolate and coffee bomb. Absolutely delicious. Great improvement on the Biscotti Break.

22 ounce bottle into snifter; no bottle dating, but was released recently. Pours dense pitch black color with a 2 fairly dense dark tan head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of big dark chocolate, cocoa, roasted malt, coffee, caramel, toast, sweet dough, dark bread, toffee, vanilla, cream, light nuttiness, and roasted earthiness. Damn nice aromas with good balance and complexity of coffee and big roast/bready malt sweetness; with great strength. Taste of big dark chocolate, coffee, cocoa, roasted malt, toast, dark bread, caramel, vanilla, toffee, cream, light char, light nuttiness, and roasted earthiness. Light roasted bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of dark chocolate, cocoa, coffee, roasted malt, caramel, toast, dark bread, toffee, light char, vanilla, cream, and roasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Damn nice complexity and balance of dark/roasted malt, coffee, and bready doughnut flavors; with huge robust maltiness and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Medium carbonation and full bodied; with a very creamy, smooth, moderately slick, and slightly chalky mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a slight warming present after the finish. Overall this is an excellent imperial porter style. All around great complexity, balance, and robustness of dark/bready malt and coffee flavors; and very smooth to sip on for the big ABV. A very enjoyable offering.

Pour from a bottle dark brown with a thin creamy head. Its great to have a stout and not think "just a typical stout"! Taste is different, sweet, like you can almost taste frosting. Super good and enjoyable!

Draft at Logan's Alley - pours almost complete black with thin brown head . Sweet milk chocolate aromas . Taste is dark cocoa with sweet frosting . Outstanding .

text: Just an overall great beer. Aroma of coffee and some sweetness. Taste of chocolate, coffee and malt creaminess and finishes with coffee and some dark chocolate hints.

Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate milk chocolate, chocolate cake, light molasses, vanilla, and a touch of roasted coffee. It pours a dark brown, virtually black, with no transparency and a large creamy dark brown head that eventually fades to a thin film. There is some sporadic webbing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with moderate milk chocolate/chocolate cake with a touch of molasses. I get a slight hint of fruit in the middle. The finish has some light-moderate roasted malt, light burnt coffee, nuts, and a touch of vanilla. As it warms, I get a touch of the 11.5% abv. Its medium-full bodied with mild carbonation and a creamy mouthfeel. Overall, its real tasty. The "Glaze" on the label had me thinking it would be like a glazed chocolate doughnut, but it makes me think more of the chocolate cake and frosted doughnut.

Poured from a 22oz bottle; thanks jbeatty!
Aroma is full of sweet chocolate with lighter roast notes and some light alcohol spice. Not much fruit esters. Medium light coffee aroma. Light sweetness that is slightly reminiscent of a glazed doughnut. 
Pours dark brown to black with a moderately sized, thick dark mocha head that slowly but steadily recedes. Some light leaving and small legs. 
Flavor starts with a fairly sweet chocolate character that slowly turns into a slightly bitter dark chocolate note. Medium bitterness helps break through the sweetness. Light roast character and medium coffee notes; this is definitely not an assertive coffee character. Light alcohol spice in the finish with some residual sweetness and light bitterness. Not much ester or phenolic character. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied and rather creamy and silky with medium low carbonation. Low astringency and medium low alcohol warmth. 
I wasnt really sure what to expect from a beer with this name, somewhat worried it was a gimmick beer, but it turned out to be a really solid sweet dark beer (bottle calls it a porter but I think sweet stout is more appropriate). Coffee character is well balanced but definitely in the background. Nice, clean yeast character does not detract from the malt notes.
Draft at local option. Black pour very little head. Oily and thick pallete. Deep cocoa raisin rich milky sweet taste. Delicious. Dessert beer

Ends with more roasted malt, chocolate, coffee, chocolate doughnuts, brownies, vanilla and light molasses. Absolutely delicious!

Aroma is chocolate, lactose, sugar, coffee. Appears darkest brown with brown head that starts out pillowy and dies down. Taste is immediately intense with some booze evident. Taste is dark chocolate, creamy coffee, milk chocolate.mouthfeel is medium to thin. Creamy.
on tap @ localoptionbier. on Pi Observance Day! creamy/rich, sweet, chocolate. way better than any doughnut.

Draft at Beer Run. Pours a dark brown color with a thin brown head. Decent head retention. Aroma of chocolate donuts, mild roast. The taste is bitter hops, chocolate donuts, mild burnt roasted malt.Medium bodied, boozy.

650ml bottle courtesy of clt85. Thanks. Pours an opaque black color with a medium tan head that slowly recedes to a fine film. The aroma is big and bold with mixed chocolates and mocha. Overall: Top shelf

Very nice.

The taste is roasty, toasty, earth, icing sugar, candy, earth, aniseed, cocoa and even more candy with a dry, roasty finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Solid.

Pitch black pour; dark tan head & lace. Glazed aroma. Hearty chocolate malts on my palate. Fresh espresso on the finish after each sip. Quite good.

Draft, pours pitch black with a medium lasting beige head and very sticky lacing. Aromas and flavor are cinnamon stick, milk chocolate, coffee, biscotti crumbles, wet clay, ash and molasses. Had on tap at wine 101 in wake forest. Sweet but not to sweet. A great beer that I would want to have again!

Very strong alcohol presence without quite reaching the "hot" level. I prefer the Imperial Biscotti as is, but Id take this happily most days.

Bottle. Poured clear dark brown color with a medium tan frothy head that mostly lasted with good to excellent lacing. Medium to heavy toasted dark chocolate malt and cookie dough aroma. Medium to full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Medium to heavy toasted dark sweet flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate to long duration. My expectations where exceeded with a very good stout.

22oz bottle, shared by tmoney99. Very dark brown, near-black color. Super dark. Thin ring of khaki head. Some roast in the nose. Dark chocolate... Some desert type aromas in the nose. Black pour with a 3 finger, creamy brown head that has great retention and leaves decent lacing. Bottle shared by Tmoney99. Pours dark brown to black in color with a small beige head. The aroma and flavor have big roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, fudge, hazelnut, caramel, doughnuts come in a bit. I can almost put myself in a coffee shop with the coffee and the doughnut. Very solid.

Bottle poured into a Belgian snifter. Pours a dark brownish black with about a finger of tan head that fades into a ring around the glass. Aromas of dark chocolate, icing, caramel, vanilla, strawberry. Tasting notes of dark chocolate, roast, coffee, sweet dough, icing. Tastes like coffee soaked donuts basically. Full body with a semi-dry finish.

On draft at Rustico in Arlington VA. Pours black with a thin tan head. Aroma of chocolate with some bourbon notes. Flavors of tobacco and licorice. Heavy bodied with a thick oily mouthfeel. Bitter roasted finish.

The color of this beer is an opaque black with a large tan head, and the aroma blends a sugary sweetness with roasted, chocolate, and caramel malts. The taste feels as if it is a perfect blend of a roasty stout and that super sugary sweet donut icing everone indulges in; in other words, it is indulgent due to the heavy umami, the mild (coffee) bitterness, and mild sweetness. The palate complements the flavor well as a result of the roasty finish, oily texture, full body, and soft carbonation.

Bottle. Pours with a pitch black hued body with a medium to large deep brown head. Aromas are of pecans, nutty, iodine, bitter chocolate, mineral coffee, roast, icing. Bottle. Very sweet, malty nose of milk chocolate, frosting, a balsamic vinegar hint, and a bit of brownies. Pours a thin, flat dark brown. Sweet yet sharp taste of light fudge, milk chocolate, a tiny butter tone, cake baker, and an odd vegetal note that I cannot place. Light body, very sweet finish. Not bad, but it falls short of the regular version.

Bottle, 02/12/2014. Pours black, fine dark tan head fades to a haze covering half the surface, dense thin ring of lacing around the glass. Aroma is round, smooth chocolate mocha coffee notes, light almond and vanilla cream, moderate sweet glazed doughnut notes, chocolate dough. Taste is sweet dark chocolate, espresso notes nicely integrated, definite doughnut glaze character coming through in the finish, vanilla accents. Thick body, quite rich. Tasty treatment of an already tasty beer.

Pours an oily black with think ring of brown head that doesnt really lace. Aroma is chocolate, roast, and bread. Taste follows, bittersweet finish, a hint of boozy burn. Thick and sticky, big and nice.

Bottle... Poured jet black with an easy forming head. Was scared about how sweet this would be. Nice dark chocolate glazed note with Boston cream. Hints of roast and thick mouthfeel. Nice addition to this series which is always impressing me. Hints of roasted coffee/mocha in the finish.
Black pour, reddish brown head. Flavors of chocolate, coffee, rich toffee notes, hints of sweet donuts(barely), fudge, brownie batter. Very tasty.
Sweeter and candy sugar verison of imperial biscotti break, The alcohol burn is strong with this one.
Had this at a recent tasting. A little thin in the palate. Definitely tasted sweetness but not much past that.
Really strong, really coffee, really big. Good stuff but I didnt get any doughnuts. Not the imperial biscotti break, but would definitely drink again.
eh, i didnt get much doughnut out of this one, just tasted like a kind of stale sweet stout.

Pours a rich burnt umber with two fingers of khaki foam. The nose is a bit weird with the obvious deep chocolate notes, some dark fruit, vanilla frosting and a touch of roasty coffee. The palate is a bit more inviting with a strange balance... rich roasty coffee and chocolate, some glazed sugar that is intriguing, a bit of slickness on the palate and some late roasty burn as the coffee brings the bitterness out in the lingering finish.

Bottle. Pours inky black with tan head, decent retention/some lace. Aroma of chocolate, fudge, coffee, roast, coconut, cherry. Taste is sweet, milk chocolate, coffee, roast. Palate is soft, slick, warming, sweet finish. Very rich and decadent.

Draft at Clinton hall NYC on the flux capacitor system! Pours a deep black color with a sweet syrupy taste. Extrely flavorful and sweet which explains how the booze creeps up on you. Good beer

The aroma is coffee, sugar glaze, chocolate, dough. The appearnce is deep black, tan head, oily lacing. The flavor is chocolate, sugar glaze, bread dough, coffee beans, really awesome. The finish is sweet, coffee beans, bitter chocolate. Medium to medium/thick in body, creamy mouthfeel. Very nicely done. Very novel idea.

bottle. pours black with rust color head. aroma is toffee and sweet coffee. bitter coffee start with a sweet chewy finish. cant pin point doughnut but good.

Tap at Proletariat. Dark pour. Nose is chocolate and roasted coffee. Sweet, thick body. Coffee and cream, sweet caramel some dark fruits roasted barley, with a sweet, warm boozey finish. Love me some coffee and doughnuts.

Strong burnt sugar taste, toasted malt, dark chocolate and coffee, vanilla, and just a hint of donut glaze. The doughnut flavor is nearly hidden, but its still quite tasty.

However, this is just IBB with a nice, deft treatment. There is definitely a sweet, doughnut like flavor in this, but it's layered in the background. The base beer still stands out a and isn't overwhelmed. Really excellent.

Bomber. If it wasn't for the coffee aroma it wold be awesome. Thankfully it doesn't taste like massive coffee. Reminds me of a cold Krispy Kreme so it's a success.

Tap at The Sanctuary. Pour is black with a medium brown head. Aroma and flavor are deep, rich, smooth roasted malt with a pleasant but not overpowering sweetness. Also a light coffee note and a light maple note. So easy to drink as well. Really nice.

Bottle from Best Damn Beer Shop, poured into a tulip. Pours black with a medium mocha head. Nose is chocolate, booze, coffee. Flavor is coffee, sweet chocolate, dark fruit. Somewhat watery mouthfeel. Overall reminded me of Rogue Double Chocolate. Id say this one is slightly over-hyped, especially at $20.

Mouth is big, rich oily and and mucnhy, crunchy chocolatety, with some coffee and cake-like quality, hints of vanilla and some roasty notes as well. It certainly aint Dunkin (which is a good thing). Fuck yeah, Id stick a candle in this as its a nice birthday brew. 42 years today (holy shit!). Evil Twin isnt such a bad dude after all. ;-)

Bomber to oversized snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a fairly viscous opaque dark brownish black with foamy mocha head. Smells good too; dark malt, chocolate, coffee, and doughnuts. Tastes like it smells with a nice, smooth mouthfeel. Theres almost a glazy sweetness to it on the mouth as well. This is really great stuff!

Bottle to glass. Pitch black pour with a dark milk chocolate, nitro like head. Really creamy and uniform. Nose is sweet chocolate, fudge, and a definite booze presence. Taste is intense bitter sweet chocolate. Thick mouth feel with a boozy warm finish. A touch sweet.

Amazingly thick motor oil consistency with a cool milkshake mouthfeel. This baby opens up with a mouth full of coffee and ends with a nice sweet doughnut finish. After drinking this, I plan to join BLET next week and become a cop!!!

Pours black into a snifter. Mocha head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Sweet chocolate and glaze aromas. Thick with chocolate and espresso upfront turning to hot dough in the lasting espresso finish.
Draft at local option. Good variation. Of this beer. Definitely reminiscent of dark horse beers.

Bottle shared by tectactoe at Jeffs. Pours black with a small foamy head that fades to a ring. Rich aroma of chocolate cake, coffee, brown sugar and light soy sauce. Taste is slightly sweet with a big coffee taste and an underlying flavor of cocoa and chocolate. I wouldnt say it tastes like "doughnut" at all really. Nice medium body and a silky smooth mouthfeel. Tasty beer but I prefer the Biscotti Break.

Bottle: black pour with a dense, black body; somewhat thick looking with a mocha colored head that transcends into a chunky collar after a few minutes. Aroma has notes of sweet cream, milk chocolates, roasted nuts, mild coffee beans, brown sugar, & a fudge cake-esque richness throughout. Though I dont inherantly get "doughnut", Ive had other doughnut infused beers & get that same, honey glazed sweetness essence in this one, even if its not explicitly "doughnuts". Taste nice & smooth, great body on this one with notes of milky cream, sweet chocolate & layered, dense fudge. Nutty back-end with a slightly burnt coffee bean note followed by a roasted malt & toasty brown sugar finish. Overall, I may like the original Imperial Biscotti Break better, but I thought this was another great beer.

On tap at avenue pub... Deeper silky black hue, less intense at the edges and topped with a thin ring of light beige head.... Fudgey chocolate nose. Mild roasty sweetness. Some nutty mild hazelnut notes ... Mostly sweet nutty and rich decadent chocolate. Modicum of bitterness on the backend. Smooth with a somewhat bigger body and adequate carbonation. Just what I was expected. Iced coffee and donut mixture.

Draft at Westbrook. Oily pitch black pour with no head. Big mouthfeel with a dark chocolate bitterness up front. Some sweetness and bread like notes with a faint hint of donut glaze in the aftertaste.

Bottle. The pour is dark with a nice thin head. The aroma is nice sweet malt. The taste is very sweet. Certainly can see where the doughnut name comes from.

Tap at maxs taphouse, baltimore. Pitch black color, brown head. Rich aroma of roasty malts, coffee, sweet notes, chocolate, maybe that doughnut there. Full body, balanced, smooth, sweetness, coffee, hops at the end. Excellent.

A phenomenal brew! First break I have tasted from Evil Twin and cannot wait to get my hands on others!

Bottle. Pours black with brown head. Nose and taste of almond, milk chocolate, frosting, dark fruit, vanilla, coffee cream and sugar cream. Full bodied.
Bottle: This is a creamy bottle of delicious awesome. The whole package is thick, sweet and delicious. This is the best Evil Twin brew I have had so far.

Bottle from Holy Grale. Pours black with a dark brown rim and a nice mocha head, great lacing. Aroma is dark fruit, chocolate, sugar, sweet bread, and noticeable booze. Taste is more dark fruit, booze, and chocolate, subtle coffee, slightest hint of glazed doughnut in the midpalate, bitter dark malt in the finish. Pretty good, would have liked more doughnut and less booziness, takes a lot of imagination while drinking this to call it a chocolate doughnut in a glass - not sure how this would do with age as the doughnut present now would likely be gone later.
22 ounce bottle. Nice looking pour. Chocolate and cocoa powder throughout. Some vanilla and almond. Big beer. Doughnuts? I dont know. I dont usually eat doughnuts.

This was the only beer I had more than once at Brewvival. There were even a few fans of this beer standing next to the taps, talking up the beer, and of course refilling their glasses as often as they could. Almost completely black, dark brown head. Aroma of chocolate covered, cream-filled doughnuts. Taste is rick, thick milk chocolate  donut icing. Delicious.
